alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 1:41AM MST until September 12 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 137 AM MST, Light rain continues over the warning area, including the Agua Fria River basin north and east of Cordes Juntion. Stream gauge reports on the Agua Fria River just east of Cordes Junction indicated a rise of 4 feet beginning around 1230 AM MST caused by heavy rainfall earlier. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 264 and 271. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bishop Creek, Osborne Spring Wash, Yarber Wash, Big Bug Creek, Ash Creek, Dry Creek, Silver Creek, Indian Creek, Brushy Wash, Badger Spring Wash, Little Ash Creek, Agua Fria River and Sycamore Creek. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
